    @pytest.mark.parametrize("num1, operation, num2, expected_result, expected_expression", [
        ('5', '+', '6', '11', '5 + 6 ='),
        ('10', '-', '3', '7', '10 - 3 ='),
        ('100', '×', '100', '10000', '100 × 100 ='),
        ('50', '÷', '5', '10', '50 ÷ 5 ='),
    ])
    def test_basic_calculator_operations(setup_calculator, num1, operation, num2, expected_result, expected_expression):
        """Parametrized test for basic calculator operations: addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division"""
        log.info(f" 'test_basic_calculator_operations' for {num1} {operation} {num2} has started")
    
        calculator = setup_calculator
        perform_operation(calculator, num1, operation, num2)
>       assert_results(calculator, expected_result, expected_expression)
